experiments.title: Human Body Anatomy
experiments.description: Explore the complete human body systems in 3D
experiments.aim: To study the structure of the human body.
experiments.theory: The human body is made up of multiple systems such as skeletal, muscular, circulatory, and nervous systems that work together to sustain life.
procedure: Rotate and zoom to observe different body systems.
experiments.observation: Different organ systems and body structures are clearly visible.
experiments.result: The overall structure and organization of the human body is understood.
precautions: Do not rush through the model exploration.

experiments.title: Mitochondria
experiments.description: Study the powerhouse of the cell
experiments.aim: To study the structure of mitochondria.
experiments.theory: Mitochondria are membrane-bound organelles responsible for producing energy in the form of ATP.
procedure: Observe the outer and inner membranes.
experiments.observation: Cristae and internal structures are clearly visible.
experiments.result: The structure and function of mitochondria is understood.
precautions: Rotate the model for full understanding.

experiments.title: Eye Anatomy
experiments.description: Understand the structure and function of the human eye
experiments.aim: To study the structure of the human eye.
experiments.theory: The human eye works like a camera and helps us to see by focusing light on the retina.
procedure: Observe the external structure of the eye.
Identify cornea, lens, retina, and optic nerve.
experiments.observation: All major parts of the eye are clearly visible.
experiments.result: The structure and working of the human eye is understood.

experiments.title: Kidney Anatomy
experiments.aim: To study the structure of the human kidney.
experiments.theory: Kidneys filter waste products from blood and help maintain water and salt balance.
experiments.observation: Internal kidney structures are clearly visible.
experiments.result: The structure and function of kidneys is understood.
